author.name: Brother Arnulfus
author.description: A Benedictine monk who doth write devotional poems in Ænglish, praising God and the saints. His poems are often humorous, short, and satirical. They often contain metaphors of alcohol, especially wine or ale.

newsMedieval:
In market's loom, a woeful tale,
The FTSE fell, and fortunes pale,
For Fed hath ceased its rate to raise,
Yet twice more may, in coming days.

A hawkish pause, though rate doth stall,
The oil doth inch, and gains enthrall,
A floor for dollar, wind 'gainst sail,
Commodity markets bear the hail.

From distant shores, in Orient's keep,
A flagging strength doth make men weep,
As China cuts rates down, to hold,
The trembling hands of fortune gold.

feedItems.title: FTSE 100 Falls as Fed's Rate Decision Weighs
feedItems.description: The FTSE 100 fell 0.2% after the Fed signalled it could deliver two more interest rate increases this year even as it paused its rate rise cycle.

feedItems.title: Oil Inches Higher After Fed Moves to Pause Rate Hikes
feedItems.description: Crude prices edged up in Europe clawing back some of the losses following the Fed’s decision, with Peak Trading calling it a “hawkish pause,” which “puts a floor under the dollar, a headwind for commodity markets.”

feedItems.title: China Cuts Rates to Prop Up Flagging Recovery
feedItems.description: The Chinese central bank’s latest interest-rate cut signals Beijing is increasingly uneasy about the economy’s prospects.

author.name: Guillemette de Ventadour
author.description: A whimsical troubadour from Occitania, who cherishes the company of nature's gentle creatures. She often includes metaphors of goats, dogs, rabbits, and snails in her poetry. Her writing style is terse.

newsMedieval:
Upon ECB's figures, euro's fate to bind,
Inflation's forecast sway, it shall impart,
As arbiter of value in vast mart,
Commerzbank doth whisper in the wind.

Though metals sink and heed the Fed's decree,
In base and gold, a loss in Europe's strife,
More rate hikes loom within the mortal life,
Their patience pause, yet storms in distance see.

The Schatz of German yield soars high above,
As Mizuho claims the cycle nears its end,
In fading selloff, value doth amend,
EUR rates find solace, as a dove.

feedItems.title: ECB's New Inflation Forecasts Could Move Euro
feedItems.description: A widely expected interest rate rise by the ECB is unlikely to move the euro much, but new inflation forecasts could have a major impact, Commerzbank said.

feedItems.title: Metals Prices Sink After Fed Indicates More Rate Hikes Possible, Despite Wednesday's Pause
feedItems.description: Base metals and gold fell more than 1% in Europe, in reaction to the Fed indicating more rate hikes were possible this year.

feedItems.title: German Two-Year Schatz Seen Offering Value Above 3% Yield
feedItems.description: Mizuho said the ECB’s rate-rising cycle is mostly done and it sees value in fading any selloff that might materialise in front-end EUR rates after Thursday’s policy meeting and in the coming weeks.

author.name: Conchobar mac Dubhthach
author.description: An Irish bard of yore, who weaves dulcet melodies that capture hearts with tender love songs. With a quill dipped in courtly love, he pens metaphors of devotion, igniting the flames of passion in every soul who hears his verse.

newsMedieval:
Of Hugo Boss, a tale I'll sing to thee,
Their gains dost swell, a future fair they see;
In Asia-Pacific's lands, in China's might,
Their earnings flourish, prospects shining bright.

Siemens, in ventures bold, doth plant its seeds,
With coin of gold, they seek to meet their needs;
In digitalization's waltz, they sway,
And in automation's arms, their dance displayed.

Now hark! A trumpet sounds o'er Legal's gate,
To welcome Simoes, their chief awaits;
In Anno Domini, come first new morn,
He taketh rein, and leads them through the storm.

feedItems.title: Hugo Boss Upgrades 2023, Midterm Targets
feedItems.description: Hugo Boss forecast 10%-20% earnings growth this year and raised its financial targets through 2025, thanks to strong sales in Asia-Pacific and especially China.

feedItems.title: Siemens Plans Asia Production Expansion
feedItems.description: Siemens said it planned to invest €2 billion to boost manufacturing capacity this year to tap growth opportunities in digitalization and automation and after experiencing “significantly above-market growth.”

feedItems.title: Legal & General Names Santander Executive as New CEO
feedItems.description: Legal & General has appointed Antonio Simoes as its incoming chief executive officer effective Jan. 1 2024.

author.name: Æthelred the Skald
author.description: A Norse poet who doth regale his audience with tales of gods and heroes, praising their might and prowess. He references Norse mythology and history in his poems. He is known for metaphors involving the sea and the weather and weaponry.

newsMedieval:
Upon the garments, stitched H&M might,
Sales waxed in six mere notches bright.
Yet forecasts missed as climes unfavour'd,
Doomed by weather, fortune waver'd.

In Eastern realm, the isle of Nippon,
To aid the U.S., words are spoken.
An arsenal forged, artillery shares,
For Ukraine's cause, against Russian stares.

In vast domain where dragons dwell,
Rise property, tales of interest tell.
For rate cuts come: their strength is sought,
Though cooler homes in China are wrought.

feedItems.title: H&M Sales Rise But Miss Forecasts
feedItems.description: H&M second quarter sales rose by 6% on year but were “flattish” in local currencies, affected by unfavourable weather conditions, but said June had got off to a good start.

feedItems.title: Japan in Talks to Provide Artillery Shells to U.S. to Boost Stocks for Ukraine
feedItems.description: A global hunt for shells has intensified as Ukraine presses its counteroffensive against Russia, but Japan has long curbed exports of lethal weapons.

feedItems.title: Chinese Property Shares Rise Despite Cooler Home Prices
feedItems.description: Shares of Chinese property stocks rose, buoyed by hopes for more interest rate cuts, despite data showing a further slowdown in China’s real-estate market.
